department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
short_summary: Request for Standing Offer (RFSO) is soliciting for the supply of light duty vehicles.
description: The Government of Canada has a requirement for light duty vehicles. This requirement is subject to a two stage competitive procurement process. The first stage is a qualification process to create a qualified Offeror list. At the second stage, only the Offerors on the list will be allowed to bid on the Request for Standing Offer (RFSO). Subsequently, all qualified Offerors meeting the mandatory criteria of the RFSO, will be eligible to become a Standing Offer (SO) holder for the supply of the 2024 or newer model year light duty vehicles and 2023 model year Zero Emission Vehicles (ZEV) & Hybrid Electric Vehicles (HEV) light duty vehicles where specified listed in the 2023-2024 GMVOG. Departmental Individual Standing Offer (DISO) / National Individual Standing Offer (NISO) will be established.

full_summary:
**Title**
DISO and NISO - Light Duty Vehicles
=====================================

**Reference and Solicitation Information**
----------------------------------------

*   **Reference Number**: WS3869981187 - Doc4115518186
*   **Solicitation Number**: WS3869981187
*   **Publication Date**: Wednesday, July 26, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date and Time**: Thursday, August 31, 2023, at 2:00:00 PM
*   **Amendment Date**: Monday, August 14, 2023

**Procurement Details**
-------------------------

The Department of Public Works and Government Services of the Government of Canada intends to establish a Departmental Individual Standing Offer (DISO) / National Individual Standing Offer (NISO) for the supply of light duty vehicles.

The term of the contract you will have to agree to will commence on September 1, 2023, with no expected conclusion date.

This procurement will be conducted using a two-stage competitive process. To be considered for the second stage, potential contractors must be pre-qualified through a qualification process. This qualification process will
 result in the creation of a list of qualified Offerors.

The Standing Offer (SO) holders will be selected based on a Request for Standing Offer (RFSO). Contract award will be made under the Supply Manual and in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in the tender documents.

**Contract Award Criteria**
---------------------------

All qualified Offerors meeting the mandatory requirements of the RFSO will be eligible to become a Standing Offer (SO) holder.

Offers will be evaluated using the following criteria:
*   Price

**Delivery Regions**
----------------------

Deliveries are expected to be made to the following regions:
\"\*\*Quebec (except NCR)\\

\"\*\*Canada\\

\"\*\*Saskatchewan\\

\"\*\*Yukon\\

\"\*\*British Columbia\\

\"\*\*Ontario (except NCR)\\

\"\*\*Newfoundland and Labrador\\

\"\*\*Prince Edward Island\\

\"\*\*National Capital Region (NCR)\\

\"\*\*Manitoba\\

\"\*\*New Brunswick\\

\"\*\*Nunavut Territory\\

\"\*\*Northwest Territories\\

\"\*\*Nova Scotia\\

\"\*\*Alberta\\

**Trade Agreements**
----------------------

This procurement is subject to the following trade agreements:
